Are you experiencing severe tooth pain, swelling, or discomfort? If so, you may be in need of a root canal treatment (RCT).At our clinic, we specialize in providing high-quality root canal treatments to relieve dental pain and restore the health of your tooth Book Appointment Today What is a Root Canal? A root canal is a dental procedure that involves removing the soft center of the tooth, known as the pulp. The pulp contains nerves, connective tissue, and blood vessels that aid in tooth growth. When the pulp becomes infected or inflamed, it can cause intense pain and discomfort. Why Choose Us for Root Canal Treatment? We understand that undergoing a root canal treatment can be a daunting experience. However, our highly skilled and experienced team of dentists will ensure that your treatment is pain-free and comfortable. Here are some reasons why you should choose us for your root canal treatment: Expertise: Dr. Manas is a skilled BDS, MDS (Endodontist & Conservative Dentist) Gold Medalist with 10+ years of experience in root canal treatments. You can trust that you are in capable hands. Equipped wtih Latest Technology: We have equipped our clinic with the latest technology, including microscopic and laser-assisted treatments, to provide you with the best possible care. Comprehensive Services: In addition to root canal treatments, we offer a range of other dental services, including laser-assisted gum treatments, full mouth rehabilitations, dental CT scans, general dentistry, and teeth whitening. Personalised care: We understand that each patient is unique and has individual needs. Our team will work closely with you to develop a personalized treatment plan that addresses your specific concerns. Is Root Canal Treatment Right for You? Root canal treatment is typically recommended for damaged or infected teeth. Some common indications for root canal treatment include dental infections, cracked teeth, deep cavities, and tooth injuries. If you are experiencing toothache, swelling, or prolonged sensitivity, it is important to seek professional dental care to determine if a root canal treatment is necessary. What to Expect During Root Canal Treatment? The root canal treatment procedure involves several steps to ensure the complete removal of infected or inflamed tooth material and the restoration of the tooths health. Here is a brief overview of the procedure:Diagnosis: Our dentist will perform a clinical examination and take x-rays to assess the extent of the infection or inflammation.Local Anesthesia: Before starting the treatment, the affected tooth will be numbed using local anesthesia to ensure a pain-free experience.Removal of Pulp: The infected or inflamed pulp will be carefully removed from the tooth.Cleaning and Shaping: The root canals will be thoroughly cleaned and shaped to remove any remaining debris or bacteria.Filling and Sealing: The cleaned root canals will be filled with a rubbery material called gutta-percha and sealed to prevent reinfection.Restoration: In some cases, a crown or cap may be placed on the treated tooth to provide additional strength and protection. Is Root Canal Treatment Right for You? Root canal treatment is typically recommended for damaged or infected teeth. Some common indications for root canal treatment include dental infections, cracked teeth, deep cavities, and tooth injuries. If you are experiencing toothache, swelling, or prolonged sensitivity, it is important to seek professional dental care to determine if a root canal treatment is necessary. Take control of your oral health. Relief from dental pain is just a step away! Contact us today to schedule a consultation and learn more about our pain-free root canal treatments. Our team is dedicated to providing you with the highest quality dental care and helping you achieve a healthy, pain-free smile.

Get Your Perfect Smile with Orthodontics - braces, clear aligners, or retainers -  In Orthodontics dentistry, our treatment is focused on diagnosing and treating bad bites (malocclusion), aligning and straightening teeths. Book Appointment Today Imagine a life where your bite aligns seamlessly, where crooked, overlapping, twisted, or gapped teeth become mere memories of the past. Orthodontics is the branch of dentistry that focuses on diagnosing and treating malocclusion, or bad bites, and common treatments include braces, clear aligners, and retainers. The way your teeth fit together, also known as your bite, has a significant impact on your oral health. Signs that you might need to see an orthodontist include having crooked, overlapped, twisted, or gapped teeth.  Metal braces: Involves metal brackets and metal wire. It is a conventional and economical option. Ceramic Braces: The brackets placed on the teeth are tooth-coloured, ceramic ones. These are less visible and softer than the metal brackets. Self-ligating Braces: They are more comfortable than regular braces and often result in reduced treatment duration. Lingual Braces: Braces are places on the inner surface of the teeth making them completely invisible. Aligners: Clear, comfortable, aesthetic. No brackets, no wires. It’s as simple as wearing a night guard!

Pain-Free and Effective Dental Solutions for  - We offer a range of painless and effective solutions, such as medicated toothpastes and creams, to prevent dental pain and maintain optimal oral health for your child. Additionally, we provide options for correcting smiles and occlusion (bite) using braces and myofunctional appliances. Book Appointment Today As parents, we want the best for our children, especially when it comes to their health. One aspect of their well-being that often gets overlooked is dental care. Many people assume that because baby teeth eventually fall out, they are not as important as permanent teeth. However, neglecting dental care during childhood can have long-lasting consequences for your childs oral health. The Rise of Cavities in Children In recent years, the incidence of cavities in children has skyrocketed. The main culprit behind this increase is the overload of sugary food and drinks in their diets. These sugary treats wreak havoc on a childs teeth, leading to painful cavities, loss of teeth at an early age, and even malnutrition. As a pediatric dentist, we have seen firsthand the impact that poor dental hygiene can have on a childs overall health and well-being. The 'Tell-Show-Do' Approach At our practice, we believe in employing a tell-show-do approach when treating children. This approach involves gradually easing children into the treatment process, ensuring that they feel comfortable and informed every step of the way. By explaining the procedure to them in a child-friendly manner, showing them the tools we will be using, and then carrying out the treatment, we help alleviate any fear or anxiety they may have. Preventive Measures Prevention is always better than cure, and this holds true for dental health as well. We offer a range of preventive measures to ensure that your childs teeth stay strong and healthy. Some of these measures include:Regular Check-ups: Scheduling regular dental check-ups allows us to monitor your childs oral health and catch any potential issues early on.Dental Cleanings: Professional cleanings help remove plaque and tartar buildup, reducing the risk of cavities and gum disease.Fluoride Treatments: Fluoride is a mineral that strengthens tooth enamel, making it more resistant to decay. We offer fluoride treatments to give your childs teeth an extra layer of protection.Dental Sealants: Dental sealants are thin, protective coatings that are applied to the chewing surfaces of the back teeth. They help prevent cavities by sealing off the deep grooves and crevices where bacteria can accumulate. Painless and Effective Treatments We understand that dental procedures can be intimidating for children. Thats why we offer painless and effective treatments to ensure that your child never experiences dental pain. Some of these treatments include: Medicated Toothpastes and Creams: We provide medicated toothpastes and creams that are specifically formulated for children. These products help prevent cavities and maintain oral hygiene. Correcting Smile and Bite Issues: We offer a range of options to correct smile and bite issues in children. Braces and myofunctional appliances can help align teeth and improve the overall function of the mouth. Pediatric dentistry plays a crucial role in ensuring the long-term oral health and well-being of your child. By prioritizing dental care from an early age, you can help prevent cavities, tooth loss, and other dental issues that can have a lasting impact on your childs smile.Remember, a healthy smile is not just about aesthetics; it is a reflection of overall health. Contact us today to give your child a happy and healthy smile! We are dedicated to helping your child have a happy and healthy smile. Reach out to us today to schedule an appointment and ensure your childs dental well-being.

Treat periodontal gum disease with scaling and root planing without undergoing surgery - This non-surgical deep cleaning technique is the gold standard for treating periodontitis because it effectively eliminates the source of the problem: tartar, plaque (biofilm), and bacteria. Book Appointment Today Say goodbye to periodontal disease and hello to improved oral health. Our treatment style is effective in removing tartar, plaque (biofilm), and bacteria from the tooth at and below the gum line and its roots. Promoting your gum tissues regeneration to grow back snug around your tooth. Get advise on maintenance therapy for enhanced gum health. Below are the key differentiations to consider: Less Pain Faster recovery time Minimal bleeding Reduced risk of complications More precise treatment Depending on the case to case scenarios, Here are 4 ways to treat the periodontal disease Scaling and root planning - This treatment involves the meticulous removal of plaque and tartar, followed by the smoothing of exposed tooth root surfaces. It is a critical step in preventing serious gum diseases and tooth loss. Scaling and root planing does not require cutting or stitches, making it a much more comfortable experience for patients. By removing the sources of infection and inflammation, your gums can naturally heal and repair itself. This non-surgical deep cleaning technique is the gold standard for treating periodontitis because it effectively eliminates the source of the problem: tartar, plaque (biofilm), and bacteria. Flap SurgeriesFlap surgery is a crucial procedure for treating infections and diseased tissues deep under the gum. It allows periodontists to access these areas and provide the best possible care. Thanks to advancements in medications, the surgery is typically painless, with minimal post-operative discomfort Bone Grafting Bone grafting is a surgical technique employed to augment the bone volume in regions of the jaw that have encountered bone loss or necessitate additional structural support. Block Bone Graft: In this particular procedure, bone is harvested from the posterior part of the jaw, typically near the wisdom teeth. It is commonly employed when significant bone loss has occurred in the front of the jaw. Sinus Lift: When bone loss in the vicinity of the upper molars results in the descent of the sinuses, a bone graft is employed to not only restore stability to the upper jaw but also to reposition the sinuses to their original location. Socket Graft: Socket grafting is a procedure where a bone graft is performed simultaneously with tooth extraction to prevent subsequent bone loss. Gum recontouring Gum contouring is a dental procedure performed by specialists to reshape or restore gum tissue around the teeth, often chosen for cosmetic improvements but occasionally necessary for treating periodontal disease. This in-office treatment involves the use of local anesthesia to minimize discomfort during the procedure, with excess gum tissue removed or reshaped using lasers or scalpels. Sutures may be needed to secure the gum tissue, and post-surgery pain and tenderness can be managed with prescribed or over-the-counter medications and cold compresses

With Cosmetic Dentistry, Achieve the Perfect Smile You've Always Dreamed Of  -  You are never fully dressed without a smile  Martin Charnin. Who doesnt love a beautiful smile?! There are a fortunate few who are naturally gifted with a perfect smile, for the rest of them, there is cosmetic dentistry!If you are someone who hesitates to smile wide or has most photographs clicked with the lips closed, then please know that there is a solution. Book Appointment Today A healthy and attractive smile can boost your self-esteem, improve your social interactions, and positively impact your professional life. Dr. Manasi, an experienced and skilled aesthetic dentist who specializes in smile makeovers.She has helped several patients regain their confidence and happiness by giving them the smile that they desired. Cosmetic dentistry focuses on improving the appearance of your teeth, gums, and bite.Advancements in dental technology and techniques, cosmetic dentistry offers a range of treatments and procedures to transform your smile and boost your confidence. Did you Know? A good smile goes a long way in restoring ones self-confidence. When you smile wide and whole heartedly, it helps build better connections with others. A pleasing smile can be the difference in someone winning an opportunity over another.Often, crooked and broken teeth pose more than an aesthetic challenge. Uneven teeth are difficult to clean. Broken teeth easily allow bacteria to enter them. Both these can result in cavities. Why Choose Dr. Manasi for Your Cosmetic Dentistry Needs? Dr. Manasi has undergone extensive training and has years of experience in cosmetic fillings, veneers, and crowns. Whether you need to repair a chipped tooth or transform your entire smile, she has the skills and knowledge to deliver exceptional results Myth Cosmetic dentistry is expensive Smile design is a lengthy process It is not worth the pain Fact There are options with as low price range as INR 1500 to 2500 Most cases are completed in 1 to 10 days Cosmetic dentistry is one of the most pain-free dental treatments Don't let a less-than-perfect smile hold you back any longer Take the first step towards achieving the smile of your dreams by scheduling a consultation with Dr. Manasi today.Together, we can transform your smile and help you rediscover the joy of smiling wide in photographs. Remember, a beautiful smile is just a phone call away. Contact us now to book your appointment.

Say Goodbye to tooth gaps and Hello to a confident, beautiful smile.  Are you experiencing gaps, food accumulation, or cavities due to missing teeth? We understand the frustration and inconvenience that can come with tooth loss.Our expert dental team considers various factors such as your geographical location, personal preferences, and budget to recommend the ideal tooth replacement based on your unique clinical situation. Book Appointment Today Reasons Why Replacing Your Missing Teeth is Essential Are you missing a tooth or multiple teeth? If so, you may be experiencing difficulties with chewing and digestion. Additionally, failing to replace a tooth can have severe dental implications. Why is replacing a missing tooth important? When a tooth is lost, it can have severe dental implications. Our teeth are arranged neatly next to each other, similar to pearls on a string. Just like when a pearl comes off the string, the other pearls become unstable, the same happens within your jaw. The rest of the teeth start shifting from their original position, leading to potential complications and misalignment.In addition to the aesthetic concerns, missing teeth also make chewing difficult, which can affect the first step in digestion. This can have a negative impact on your overall health as it jeopardizes the absorption of nutrients by the body. Options for tooth replacement We offer several options for tooth replacement, each with varying degrees of cost and time frame. Our experienced team will help you choose the best option that suits your individual needs. Here are some of the options we provide: Dental Implants Dental implants are a popular and permanent solution for replacing missing teeth. They involve surgically placing a titanium implant into the jawbone, which serves as a stable foundation for a replacement tooth. A dental implant is a surgical fixture that replaces the root of a missing tooth and fuses with the jawbone through a process called osseointegration. Dental implants look, feel, and function just like natural teeth. Dental Bridges Dental bridges are prosthetic devices that bridge the gap created by one or more missing teeth. They are anchored to the adjacent teeth on either side of the gap, providing a stable and natural-looking replacement.They are made up of two or more crowns for the teeth on either side of the gap and a false tooth or teeth in between. The crowns, also known as abutment teeth, serve as anchors for the bridge, while the false tooth or teeth, called pontics, fill in the gap.Dental bridges help restore the appearance and function of the teeth, improving the ability to chew and speak properly. They also prevent the remaining teeth from shifting and provide support to the facial structure. Partial or Full Dentures Dentures are removable dental appliances that replace missing teeth. They can be made from various materials, including plastics and metal. The main purpose of dentures is to fill in the gaps in your smile by attaching one or more artificial teeth.They can be either full dentures, replacing all teeth in the upper or lower jaw, or partial dentures, which replace only a few missing teeth. Dentures are a cost-effective option for tooth replacement and can be customized to fit your unique smile Don't let missing teeth affect your quality of life. Choose from range of options for Replacing your Missing Teeth. Whether youre in need of dental implants, dental bridges, or partial/full dentures, our expert dental team is here to help. Get in touch today!
